invade.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it
invade.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
invade.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to go into a place in large numbers, especially when you are not wanted
invade.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Every summer, the town is invaded by tourists.
Fans invaded the pitch at half time.
invade.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to get involved in something in an unwanted and annoying way
invade.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: What right does he have to invade my privacy?
Patients are given the feeling that they mustnâ€™t try to invade medical territory  (=try to deal with things that are not their responsibility).
